item.title: Festive Gingerbread Cinnamon Rolls for Holiday Cheer
item.description: Indulge in the warm, spiced flavors of these gingerbread cinnamon rolls topped with creamy frosting. Perfect for holiday gatherings, they bring festive cheer to any table. Try making them for your next celebration! | â±ï¸ Prep: 15min | Cook: 30min | Serves: 12 | #cat1761230294638 #mediumrecipe #1hourmeals #recipe #cooking
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 15 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 30 minutes

â° Total Time: 45 minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 12

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Medium

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 2 cups all-purpose flour
  • 1/2 cup brown sugar
  • 1 tablespoon ground ginger
  • 1 tablespoon ground cinnamon
  • 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg
  • 1/4 teaspoon cloves
  • 1/2 teaspoon salt
  • 1 packet active dry yeast
  • 3/4 cup warm milk
  • 1/4 cup unsalted butter, melted
  • 1 egg
  • 1 cup cream cheese, softened
  • 2 cups powdered sugar
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. In a bowl, combine warm milk and yeast, letting it sit for 5 minutes.
  2. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together flour, brown sugar, ginger, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, and salt.
  3. Add the yeast mixture, melted butter, and egg to the dry ingredients, mixing until a dough forms.
  4. Knead the dough on a floured surface for about 5 minutes until smooth.
  5. Roll out the dough into a rectangle, spread softened butter, and sprinkle with a mixture of brown sugar and spices.
  6. Roll the dough tightly and cut into 12 equal pieces.
  7. Place rolls in a greased baking dish and let rise for 30 minutes.
  8. Preheat the oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C) and bake for 25-30 minutes until golden.
  9. While baking, beat cream cheese, powdered sugar, and vanilla until smooth.
  10. Spread frosting over warm rolls before serving.
